item.title: Risk of regional war hangs over Gaza ceasefire talks
item.description: The US believes a deal could help calm the Middle East, but do Israel and Hamas's leader want one?

item.title: Macron Honors African Soldiers Who Helped Liberate France in World War II
item.description: Two months after D-Day, an Allied force dominated by soldiers conscripted from French colonies swept into southern France. It’s a chapter of its history that France has long obscured.

item.title: Gaza cease-fire talks resume in Qatar without Hamas in attendance
item.description: Israel and the United States, with mediating partners Egypt and Qatar, resumed high-stake negotiations in Doha over a cease-fire and hostage release deal.

item.title: What! Man dresses as Vivek Ramaswamy at Trump's Montana rally. Here's what happened next
item.description: ​An influencer by the name of Dohaa the Explorer claimed he dressed up like Indian-American businessman and former GOP presidential hopeful Vivek Ramaswamy and then attended Donald Trump's Montana rally. He made a full-length YouTube video detailing how he prepared for the prank -- after many of his audience told him that he bore resemble with Vivek.

item.title: Ukraine using UK-gifted tanks in Russia offensive: Reports
Donald Trump seeks delay in sentencing for hush money case until after November election
item.description: Former President Donald Trump sought a delay in his sentencing for the New York hush money case until after the presidential election. His lawyer argued that proceeding before Election Day could constitute election interference. The legal team emphasised the need for more time due to the complexity of the case and Trump’s campaign as the Republican nominee.

item.title: Anti-Israel protesters clash with law enforcement after Kamala Harris rally in NYC
item.description: Pro-Palestinian protesters clashed with law enforcement after storming an afterparty following Vice President Kamala Harris' rally in New York City. Demonstrators caused chaos, shouting and unleashing smoke bombs. Amid protests, Harris addressed the crowd, emphasising democracy and opposing confrontational politics. The Biden administration's support of Israel sparked the demonstrations, highlighting a contentious issue in their campaign.

item.title: Labour ‘putting rail passengers first’, says minister as she blames Tories for prolonging strikes – as it happened
item.description:
This live blog is now closed you can read more of our UK political coverage here

Chief secretary to the Treasury Darren Jones has said the pay deal offered to train drivers was “good deal for the taxpayer”, because it was “resetting the relationship between government and public sector workers” and preventing strikes.

PA Media reports he said:

There is a direct cost to the economy if the strikes continue and we need to work together in partnership with workers and trade unions and business in order to get sustainable growth back into the economy. So this is a good deal for the taxpayer, it’s a good deal for the economy.

Making pensioners freeze, slashing services, cutting defence projects, increasing rail fares and raising tax all to fund inflation busting pay deals for trade union donors are political choices made by Labour. They are choosing to placate their union donors over everyone else.

Continue reading...

item.title: Harris and Biden to make speech on lowering prices for Americans; Walz and Vance debate confirmed for 1 October – live
item.description:
First joint event since Biden stood aside comes amid news that people receiving Medicare will get discounts of up to 79% on some medicines

  • 10 popular medicines to be less expensive for those with Medicare

Donald Trump’s campaign has made a slew of new hires as he looks to get his footing against Democrat Kamala Harris, including bringing Corey Lewandowski, who managed part of his 2016 run, onto its leadership team.

Other hires on the team include Washington Times columnist and communications strategist Tim Murtaugh, political consultant Alex Bruesewitz and Taylor Budowich and Alex Pfeiffer, both of whom are associated with the Make American Great Again Super Pac.

Continue reading...

item.title: Trump requests hush-money sentencing take place after election day
item.description:
Ex-president’s lawyer says September sentencing would be election interference and there’s no ‘basis’ for ‘rushing’

Donald Trump is asking the judge in his New York hush-money criminal case to delay his sentencing until after the November presidential election.

In a letter made public Thursday, a lawyer for the former US president and current Republican nominee suggested that sentencing Trump as scheduled on 18 September – about seven weeks before election day – would amount to election interference.

Continue reading...

item.title: Google says Iranian group tried to hack Trump and Harris campaigns
item.description:
Tech company says group linked to Revolutionary Guard still actively targeting Biden, Trump and Harris associates

Google said on Wednesday that an Iranian group linked to the country’s Revolutionary Guard has tried to infiltrate the personal email accounts of roughly a dozen people linked to Joe Biden, the former president Donald Trump and the vice-president, Kamala Harris, since May.

The tech company’s threat intelligence arm said the group was still actively targeting people associated with Biden, Trump and Harris, who replaced Biden as the Democratic candidate last month when he dropped out. It said those targeted included current and former government officials, as well as presidential campaign affiliates.

Continue reading...

item.title: Revealed: Shell oil non-profit donated to anti-climate groups behind Project 2025
item.description:
Foundation says it ‘does not endorse any organizations’ while funneling hundreds of thousands to rightwing causes

A US foundation associated with oil company Shell has donated hundreds of thousands of dollars to religious right and conservative organizations, many of which deny that climate change is a crisis, tax records reveal.

Fourteen of those groups are on the advisory board of Project 2025, a conservative blueprint proposing radical changes to the federal government, including severely limiting the Environment Protection Agency.

Continue reading...

item.title: Walz to grill Vance on Project 2025 in first vice-presidential debate
item.description:
Democratic VP nominee pushes back against his rival’s abortion comments as they agree to 1 October debate

In a possible early preview of their debate in October, Tim Walz, the Democratic vice-presidential nominee, has pushed back against an attempt by his Republican rival, JD Vance, to imply that abortion is not a “normal” concern for women voters.

Vance was asked by Laura Ingraham on Fox News how he would respond to suburban women who feared a national abortion ban. “First of all, I don’t buy that Laura,” he replied. “I think most suburban women care about the normal things most Americans care about right now.”

Continue reading...

item.title: Ukrainian President Zelenskyy says Kyiv troops have full control of the Russian town of Sudzha
Hidden-camera video shows Project 2025 co-author discussing his secret work preparing for a second Trump term
Russian lawmaker Butina says the West is 'poking the bear' with Ukraine incursion
